00001 ###########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the List object
00004 #
00005 package Value::List;
00006 my $pkg = 'Value::List';
00007 
00008 use strict; no strict "refs";
00009 our @ISA = qw(Value);
00010 
00011 #
00012 #  Make a List out of a list of entries or a
00013 #    reference to an array of entries, or the data from a Value object
00014 #
00015 sub new {
00016   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00017   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00018   my $def = $context->lists->get("List");
00019   my $p = shift; my $isFormula = 0;
00020   my $isSingleton = (scalar(@_) == 0 && !(Value::isValue($p) && $p->classMatch('List')));
00021   $p = $p->data if (Value::isValue($p) && $p->classMatch('List') && scalar(@_) == 0);
00022   $p = [] unless defined $p;
00023   $p = [$p,@_] if ref($p) ne 'ARRAY' || scalar(@_) > 0;
00024   my $type;
00025   foreach my $x (@{$p}) {
00026     $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context) unless ref($x);
00027     $isFormula = 1 if Value::isFormula($x);
00028     if (Value::isValue($x)) {
00029       if (!$type) {$type = $x->type}
00030         else {$type = 'unknown' unless $type eq $x->type}
00031     } else {$type = 'unknown'}
00032     if (!$isSingleton && $x->type eq 'List') {
00033       $x->{open}  = $def->{nestedOpen}  unless $x->{open};
00034       $x->{close} = $def->{nestedClose} unless $x->{close};
00035     }
00036   }
00037   return $p->[0] if ($isSingleton && $type eq 'List' && !$p->[0]{open});
00038   return $self->formula($p) if $isFormula;
00039   my $list = bless {data => $p, type => $type, context=>$context}, $class;
00040   $list->{correct_ans} = $p->[0]{correct_ans}
00041     if $isSingleton && defined scalar(@{$p}) && defined $p->[0]{correct_ans};
00042   if (scalar(@{$p}) == 0) {
00043     $list->{open}  = $def->{nestedOpen};
00044     $list->{close} = $def->{nestedClose};
00045   }
00046   return $list;
00047 }
00048 
00049 #
00050 #  Return the proper data
00051 #
00052 sub typeRef {
00053   my $self = shift;
00054   return Value::Type($self->class, $self->length, Value::Type($self->{type},1));
00055 }
00056 
00057 sub isOne {0}
00058 sub isZero {0}
00059 
00060 #
00061 #  Turn arbitrary data into a List
00062 #
00063 sub promote {
00064   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00065   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00066   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift : $self);
00067   return $x->inContext($context) if ref($x) eq $class && scalar(@_) == 0;
00068   return $self->new($context,$x,@_)
00069     if (scalar(@_) > 0 || !Value::isValue($x) || Value::isComplex($x));
00070   return $self->make($context,$x->value);
00071 }
00072 
00073 ############################################
00074 #
00075 #  Operations on lists
00076 #
00077 
00078 #
00079 #  Add is concatenation
00080 #
00081 sub add {
00082   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrder(@_);
00083   $l = Value::makeValue($l) unless Value::isValue($l);
00084   $r = Value::makeValue($r) unless Value::isValue($r);
00085   $l = $self->make($l) unless Value::classMatch($l,'List');
00086   $r = $self->make($r) unless Value::classMatch($r,'List');
00087   return $self->new($l->value,$r->value);
00088 }
00089 sub dot {my $self = shift; $self->add(@_)}
00090 
00091 #
00092 #  Lexicographic compare
00093 #
00094 sub compare {
00095   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00096   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00097   my $cmp = 0; my $n = scalar(@l); $n = scalar(@r) if scalar(@r) < $n;
00098   foreach my $i (0..$n-1) {
00099     $cmp = $l[$i] <=> $r[$i];
00100     return $cmp if $cmp;
00101   }
00102   return scalar(@l) <=> scalar(@r);
00103 }
